Summary: Witness to an attempted UFO recovery by the US Government
divs: sighting detailsin the evening on march 31, 1982 i witnessed the us goverenment attempt to recover what they must have thought was a downed alien craft. in brief: a large triangular craft approx 500-800 ft above ground flew directly overhead at an extremely slow airspeed in what is (was) otherwise airspace a few miles from detroit metro airport, and furthermore directly in the same exact airspace used by some departing airliners heading in an easterly direction. lived the in the area for long enough time to be able to time a 747 flying overhead to be out of site in a matter of minutes. know enough about airplanes to know what they look, sound, and handle like when flying. as the craft 'glided' overhead i observed lights at each 'point' on the craft. additionally, i witnessed what i believe to be 'windows' along the trailing edges of the craft. furthermore, due to extreme slow airspeed of the craft, and due to its very low (for the normal air traffic pattern) altitude, i believe that i witnessed living organisms both standing next to and walking along the pathway of the window bank. approximately 0.5 - 1 mile due south of the craft (as the craft was overhead) i witnessed approximately 12+ helicopters with searchlights both scanning the sky as well as the ground. this was well after sunset and on a clear cloudless or near cloudless night with no or very low winds. i believe that the craft was desending in altitude as it traveled due east and must have reached its lowest altitude at or near to where i observed the craft. as the craft was overhead and moving very slow, i witnessed the craft gradually gain altitude and move so far away that it could only be observed as a single point of light against the night time sky. at that point when it was its furthest away it had taken approximately 25-30 minutes. all the while as the craft was moving to the east and gaining altitude the helicopters continued to search with their searchlights both sky and ground. considering the flight path of the craft and its very close proximity to detroit metro airport, and the atmospheric conditions of the night, the faa air trffic controllers would have had a very good and very long look at what was happening in their airspace. additionally, being detroit metro is a busy airport, there were no other aircraft in the visible sky during the event. normally there were always flights taking off and passing overhead on their eastward flight paths; during the ~30 minute event there were no flights at all. i am not even certain how long it was before a passenger airliner even passed overhead again. i do not recall any flights that evening passing through thier normal route to the east. in short, the craft slowly gained in altitude and dissappeared to the east in approx 30 minutes. an airliner normally dissappeared in ~1\10th of that time. the helicopters also left the area though i do not recall in what direction they departed as i was observing the craft and not too interested in the helicopters. though, i do recall that the helicopters when entering the area did so from a westerly direction; that is to say that the helicopters were attempting to follow the craft (though they were about 0.5 - 1 mile south of the craft). considering that the helicopters were searching such a small region of airspace and ground, and were due south of my position, i can conclude that through whatever means they were 'tracking' the craft, that the craft reached its lowest altitude at the point at which i oberserved it fly directly overhead. at the time the area was somewhat rural and given it was in the evening, and unless an observer were to just and happen to look up and see it (though it was dark in color) there were likely not more than a handfull of other observers to the incident. though i am very certain that the air traffic controllers both at detroit metro and at willow run airports had the next best possible oberservations of the craft other than my own. i can only logically conclude that the us government believed that the craft had 'come down' in the area (perhaps thinking it had crashed) and were attempting to locate and recover the craft. additionally, i would estimate the craft to be larger than a boeing 747. it was indeed a solid craft and not a flight of ultralite airplanes: it blocked the stars from sight as it passed overhead. i can only wonder about the records of flight activity at detroit metro that evening. perhaps there is a way to cooberate this sighting with the airports records of that night.
